title.rendered: Should You Choose Living In A Hotel Over Renting?

content.rendered:
Traveling is a fun, exciting experience, whether you’re going solo or with a group. If you’re exploring new cities and countries, it’s even more so! Imagine this scenario: your trip has been planned for only a few days, but you reach your destination and fall in love. Now, you find yourself planning to move there. Suddenly your priorities change from looking for famous sights to finding a place to live!

Whether you’re a digital nomad or plan to put roots down, it’s important to find the perfect place to live. If you’re on holiday, a nice place at a cheaper price is always an advantage because you’ll have more money to spend on food and sightseeing! But, if you’re moving to a city permanently, you’ll have other costs to worry about like utilities, food, and so on!

So, which is the better option – living in a hotel or renting a room? Let’s start off by exploring the pros and cons of living in a hotel…

Pros and Cons of Living in a Hotel

The easiest way to make a decision is by looking at the advantages and disadvantages you’d face with each property. If you choose a hotel, you’ll have comfort in the form of room service and someone to carry your bags. On the other hand, you’d likely end up spending more!

Pros of Living in a Hotel

1. Convenience

As is the norm when you book a room at any decent hotel, you’ll have the convenience of various different services. The most common one is room service – you can order food and beverages directly to your room. You can also ask the housekeeping team to give you clean bedsheets and towels, every day of your stay. Some of the fancier establishments may also have a laundry service that you can use at an extra charge.

2. Meet other travelers

Whether you’re booking a room for a few days or several months, you’ll have the opportunity to meet many interesting people. If you enjoy socializing and networking but work remotely, staying at a hotel is a great way to meet international travelers.

3. Central location

Maybe the biggest advantage of living in a hotel instead of renting a room is location. You’re more likely to find a hotel in the city center, right at the heart of everything! This is perfect for those of you who require connectivity for work. hotels often utilize advanced hotel management software to enhance the guest experience. Software such as RoomRaccoon, Cloudbeds, and Hotelogix ensure efficient operations, seamless booking processes, and personalized services, making your stay not only convenient but also comfortable.

Cons of Living in a Hotel

1. More expensive

When you compare the price of living in a hotel for a week vs renting a room, you’ll realize just how much more you’ll be spending on a hotel! Sure, a hotel room may come with room service and housekeeping. But, you’re sure to find cheap rooms for rent that come equipped with a washing machine for your laundry. And room service? How likely are you to order in from your room when you have all those new restaurants and cuisines to explore? Not very likely – are we right?

2. Less space

If you rent a room in an apartment or even an entire place to yourself, you won’t be restrained by space! You’ll also have the freedom of treating your rented place like your own. This is especially advantageous if you’re staying for a longer period of time – as is access to a kitchen. Some places even come equipped with a balcony or patio so you can entertain guests outdoors!

3. Crowded, noisy locations

Hotels are targeted towards people who want to be in the center of the city. If this doesn’t sound like you, you can find quieter, more peaceful options if you rent a room. This way, you can choose the accommodation that is away from the hustle and bustle for a more relaxing stay. Plus, you can find cheap rooms for rent that are priced low because they’re away from the main tourist area.

So, living in a hotel room or renting a room?

At the end of the day, it comes down to two things. First, how much money you’re willing to spend and second, how much time you’ll be spending at your accommodation. That said, no matter whether you like to be out and about or just by yourself, renting a room has several advantages! You’ll have more freedom, more space, and more amenities! And the best part is, finding a room is not very difficult.

By using a room finder like Roomi, you can find a budget-friendly place more quickly and easily. All you have to do is sign up and start looking. With rooms for rent in every major city, lots of amenities to choose from, and the option of whole places, rooms, or shared digs, we’ve got all bases covered. Happy room hunting!

Roomi is your one-stop option to list or find rooms, find roommates to settle into a new city easily. Download the app and sign up today!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
FIND ROOMMATES
